intro: Connarus falcatus, commonly known as the sickle-leaf connarus, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its elongated, sickle-shaped leaves that are often leathery in texture. Its small, white flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, round berries as fruit. Connarus falcatus is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
